title: Here's what the Cubs' World Series gear would have looked like
text:
Ready or not, here’s the Cubs gear that would have been hitting the shelves had the Cubs clinched their first NL pennant in 70 years.
Sorry Chicago, here's what a #Cubs World Series berth would've looked like.
WAY MORE HERE: https://t.co/XrtUJMJvBI pic.twitter.com/fgB2UG3zKT
— Chris Creamer (@sportslogosnet) October 22, 2015
Click here to see the entire collection, including shirts, caps, glasses, bats, balls and much more.
The would-be shirts and hats are probably salt in the wound for many Cubs fans still recovering from the sting of last night’s Game 4 elimination loss in the NLCS.
Michael Wilbon says Cubs' loss not as disappointing as usual But don’t feel too bad. The 97-win Cubs were projected for just 81.5 wins by Vegas back in February.
With a nucleus of young talent, that World Series gear might actually be available for purchase in 2016.
Are the Cubs on the verge of a dynasty? 13 teams with fewer than 97 wins that had a higher over/under than the Cubs Start Slideshow » Here's what the Cubs World Series gear would have looked like.
Vegas over/under: 84.5. Actual win total: 81 | Mitchell Layton/Getty Images
Vegas over/under: 93. Actual win total: 83 | Mitchell Layton/Getty Images
